articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: U.N. Resolution Condemns Myanmar’s Abuse of Rohingya
articles.description: The General Assembly passed a resolution denouncing human rights abuses against Rohingya Muslims and other minority groups.
articles.content:
UNITED NATIONS The United Nations General Assembly has approved a resolution strongly condemning rights abuses against Rohingya Muslims and other minority groups in Myanmar, including arbitrary arrests, torture, rape and deaths in detention.
In a 134-9 vote … [+1038 chars]

articles.author: Gretchen McCulloch
articles.title: We Learned To Write The Way We Talk
articles.description: Ironic Capitals and strettttchedddd out words have allowed us to communicate our feelings in writing like never before.
articles.content:
Its an internet tradition, when humor or sarcasm goes astray online, to apologize by saying something like, You know, its just impossible to convey tone in writing.
But what Ive noticed as the 2010s come to an end is that this apology isnt needed as much as … [+7603 chars]

articles.author: Ernesto Londoño and Letícia Casado
articles.title: ‘The Pendulum Has Swung Back’: Latin America’s Corruption Fight Stalls
articles.description: A drive against graft that started in Brazil left many hoping for a fairer, more equal region. That era is over.
articles.content: For some, seeing Brazils most commanding political figure in jail was the culmination of the anti-corruption drive and evidence that the law was finally being applied equally to everyone. For others, it was evidence that the investigation was politically cont… [+1819 chars]

articles.author: Dan Levin
articles.title: As More Mothers Fill Prisons, Children Suffer ‘A Primal Wound’
articles.description: At least 5 million children have had a parent behind bars. The toll is exacting, from unstable homes to lasting effects on their well-being.
articles.content: Maggie Luna, a single parent whose first prison term began in 2011 after she was convicted of writing bad checks, has lost custody of her three children. A Texas judge terminated her parental rights in 2014 after she failed a drug test, she said. Unable to af… [+1185 chars]

articles.title: 9 Shot, 2 Fatally, in Ambush at Music Video Filming, Official Says
articles.description: A group of men were filming a rap video when shots were fired Friday night in a parking lot near Houston.

articles.title: Detained for a Year, American Languishes in Russian Prison
articles.description: Members of Congress and his family members are pushing the Trump administration to step up its efforts to pressure Moscow to release Paul Whelan.
